info.game_comments: The IBM Challenge game 1, Jeopardy! Round only.

(1, 1).clue: Wanted for a 12-year crime spree of eating King Hrothgar's warriors; officer Beowulf has been assigned the case

(2, 1).clue: "And anytime you feel the pain, hey" this guy "refrain, don't carry the world upon your shoulders"

(3, 1).clue: Milorad Cavic almost upset this man's perfect 2008 Olympics, losing to him by one hundredth of a second

(4, 1).clue: Disneyland opens & the peace symbol is created

(5, 1).clue: It's Michelangelo's fresco on the wall of the Sistine Chapel, depicting the saved & the damned

(6, 1).clue: 4-letter word for a vantage point or a belief

(1, 2).clue: His victims include Charity Burbage, Mad Eye Moody & Severus Snape; he'd be easier to catch if you'd just name him!

(2, 2).clue: This title gal, "children at your feet, wonder how you manage to make ends meet"

(3, 2).clue: In 1908 in this city U.S. flag-bearer Ralph Rose caused controversy by not lowering the flag when passing the king

(4, 2).clue: The Empire State Building opens & the "War of the Worlds" radio broadcast causes a panic

(5, 2).clue: From the Latin for "end", this is where trains can also originate

(6, 2).clue: 4-letter word for the iron fitting on the hoof of a horse or a card-dealing box in a casino

(1, 3).clue: Wanted for general evil-ness; last seen at the Tower of Barad-Dur; it's a giant eye, folks, kinda hard to miss

(2, 3).clue: "Bang bang" his "silver hammer came down upon her head"

(3, 3).clue: A 1976 entrant in the "modern" this was kicked out for wiring his epee to score points without touching his foe

(4, 3).clue: Klaus Barbie is sentenced to life in prison & DNA is first used to convict a criminal

(5, 3).clue: To push one of these paper products is to stretch established limits

(6, 3).clue: A piece of wood from a tree, or to puncture with something pointed

(1, 4).clue: Wanted for killing Sir Danvers Carew; appearance--pale & dwarfish; seems to have a split personality

(2, 4).clue: She "died in the church and was buried along with her name. Nobody came"

(3, 4).clue: In the 2004 opening ceremonies a sole member of this team opened the parade of nations; the rest of his team closed it

(4, 4).clue: The first flight takes place at Kitty Hawk & baseball's first World Series is played

(5, 4).clue: It's a 4-letter term for a summit; the first 3 letters mean a type of simian

(6, 4).clue: Stylish elegance, or students who all graduated in the same year

(1, 5).clue: Wanted for stealing a loaf of bread in "Les Miserables"; really, really wanted, for other thefts too

(2, 5).clue: "So I sing a song of love" this woman, also the name of John's mother

(3, 5).clue: It was the anatomical oddity of U.S. gymnast George Eyser, who won a gold medal on the parallel bars in 1904

(4, 5).clue: The first modern crossword puzzle is published & Oreo cookies are introduced

(5, 5).clue: Tickets aren't needed for this "event", a black hole's boundary from which matter can't escape

(6, 5).clue: A thief, or the bent part of an arm
